metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12413 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Raccoon attack is a timing attack on DHE ciphersuites inherit in the TLS specification. To mitigate this vulnerability, Firefox disabled support for DHE ciphersuites.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12413` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.14
libnss3-tools - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.14
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> nss doesn't reuse DHE keys, but does reuse ECDHE keys, which is not problematic for the moment. See page 13 of https://raccoon-attack.com/RacoonAttack.pdf and the nss release notes for 3.17: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Projects/NSS/NSS_3.17_release_notes Since 3.17 includes a way to disable ECDHE key reuse with the SSL_REUSE_SERVER_ECDHE_KEY option, marking this CVE as fixed in fixed in 3.17.

criterions.comment: nss package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:3.35-2ubuntu2.14').
